message.raw:
The problem appears in the upgrade and it is particularly interesting in the case of drcsim, which is highly dependent of the ubuntu distribution being used.

You are keeping drcsim (hydro) in an Ubuntu distribution (probably Trusty) that only has drcsim (indigo). This package migrations are handling usually by setting up a Conflict, but since drcsim uses the same package name, we can not do it.

Could you try the following:
```
dpkg -r drcsim
apt-get install -f
apt-get remove ros-hydro-gazebo*
apt-get install drcsim
```

Should bring drcsim indigo in trusty (assuming that you are in Trusty).
message.html:
The problem appears in the upgrade and it is particularly interesting in the case of drcsim, which is highly dependent of the ubuntu distribution being used.

You are keeping drcsim (hydro) in an Ubuntu distribution (probably Trusty) that only has drcsim (indigo). This package migrations are handling usually by setting up a Conflict, but since drcsim uses the same package name, we can not do it.

Could you try the following:

dpkg -r drcsim
apt-get install -f
apt-get remove ros-hydro-gazebo*
apt-get install drcsim

Should bring drcsim indigo in trusty (assuming that you are in Trusty).
